title: Run web3js-eea examples with Besu <> Tessera network

labels.name: TeamRevenant
labels.description: GH issues worked on by Revenant Team

body:
Run web3js-eea examples with Besu <> Tessera network
Besu with --privacy-enabled
Tessera with mode=orion
- [x] accessPublicState
- [x] concurrentPrivateTransactions
- [x] eventLogs
- [x] multiNodeExample
- [x] multiNodeExamplePrivacyGroup
- [x] multiNodeExamplePrivateCall
- [x] privacyGroupManagement

- [x] multiTenancy
- [x] multiTenancyExampleOnchainPrivacyEventLogs
- [ ] multiTenancyExamplePrivateCall
- [x] onChainPrivacy
onchainPrivacy examples work if 3 besu nodes are running, otherwise the scripts hang - suspect this is the same with Besu/Orion
note for password-protected keys, I had to generate new ones for tessera https://docs.tessera.consensys.net/en/latest/HowTo/Generate-Keys/File-Stored-Keys/

multiTenancyExamplePrivateCall

```
➜  multiTenancyExamplePrivateCall git:(deploy-contract-size-bug) ✗ node deployContract.js
creating privacy group
(node:32708) UnhandledPromiseRejectionWarning: Error: Returned error: Unable to determine nonce for account in group.
    at Object.ErrorResponse (/Users/sallymacfarlane/workspace/web3js-eea/node_modules/web3-core-helpers/src/errors.js:29:16)
    at /Users/sallymacfarlane/workspace/web3js-eea/node_modules/web3-core-requestmanager/src/index.js:140:36
    at XMLHttpRequest.request.onreadystatechange (/Users/sallymacfarlane/workspace/web3js-eea/node_modules/web3-providers-http/src/index.js:110:13)
    at XMLHttpRequestEventTarget.dispatchEvent (/Users/sallymacfarlane/workspace/web3js-eea/node_modules/xhr2-cookies/dist/xml-http-request-event-target.js:34:22)
    at XMLHttpRequest._setReadyState (/Users/sallymacfarlane/workspace/web3js-eea/node_modules/xhr2-cookies/dist/xml-http-request.js:208:14)
    at XMLHttpRequest._onHttpResponseEnd (/Users/sallymacfarlane/workspace/web3js-eea/node_modules/xhr2-cookies/dist/xml-http-request.js:318:14)
    at IncomingMessage.<anonymous> (/Users/sallymacfarlane/workspace/web3js-eea/node_modules/xhr2-cookies/dist/xml-http-request.js:289:61)
```
Besu shows this error
```
2021-03-26 14:43:55.420+10:00 | vert.x-worker-thread-8 | ERROR | PrivGetTransactionCount | Privacy group Id[J6uZHKOrVqDe4djJuR3ejJtYgtAzfja8wMssoNzLm4U=] not found
org.hyperledger.besu.enclave.EnclaveClientException: Privacy group Id[J6uZHKOrVqDe4djJuR3ejJtYgtAzfja8wMssoNzLm4U=] not found
	at org.hyperledger.besu.enclave.Enclave.parseResponse(Enclave.java:173)
	at org.hyperledger.besu.enclave.Enclave.handleJsonResponse(Enclave.java:159)
	at org.hyperledger.besu.enclave.Enclave.lambda$retrievePrivacyGroup$7(Enclave.java:135)
```
and it doesn't seem to be sending the privacygroup to tessera

but the multiNodeExamplePrivateCall works fine - so is this to do with multi-tenancy setup?
```
➜  multiNodeExamplePrivateCall git:(deploy-contract-size-bug) ✗ node deployContract.js
The privacy group created is: Rch1DQZfWN5twvKIN7poE0ofYx7ZjxZZEX/XB+8HUcM=
got privacy group id Rch1DQZfWN5twvKIN7poE0ofYx7ZjxZZEX/XB+8HUcM=
Transaction Hash  0xc5f907bae5a8a94a37b4e6f5abfd503fe7db3dd57c11a986590a094efb649a9f
Waiting for transaction to be mined ...
Private Transaction Receipt
 {
  contractAddress: '0x4de2f71ab6705efc8a26f330abd4b0a73eec526a',
  from: '0xfe3b557e8fb62b89f4916b721be55ceb828dbd73',
```
and I can see tessera creating the group
```
2021-03-26 15:18:02.151 [pool-2-thread-1] INFO  c.q.t.p.p.PartyInfoBroadcaster - Finished PartyInfo polling round
2021-03-26 15:18:05.207 [qtp414978148-41] INFO  c.q.tessera.q2t.PrivacyGroupResource - Enter Request : POST : /createPrivacyGroup
2021-03-26 15:18:05.211 [pool-10-thread-1] INFO  c.q.t.q2t.RestPrivacyGroupPublisher - Publishing privacy group to http://localhost:8082/
2021-03-26 15:18:05.228 [pool-10-thread-1] INFO  c.q.t.q2t.RestPrivacyGroupPublisher - Published privacy group to http://localhost:8082/
2021-03-26 15:18:05.230 [qtp414978148-41] INFO  c.q.tessera.q2t.PrivacyGroupResource - Exit Request : POST : /createPrivacyGroup
2021-03-26 15:18:05.230 [qtp414978148-41] INFO  c.q.tessera.q2t.PrivacyGroupResource - Response for createPrivacyGroup : 200 OK
2021-03-26 15:18:05.283 [qtp414978148-85] INFO  c.q.tessera.q2t.PrivacyGroupResource - Enter Request : POST : /retrievePrivacyGroup
2021-03-26 15:18:05.292 [qtp414978148-85] INFO  c.q.tessera.q2t.PrivacyGroupResource - Exit Request : POST : /retrievePrivacyGroup
2021-03-26 15:18:05.293 [qtp414978148-85] INFO  c.q.tessera.q2t.PrivacyGroupResource - Response for retrievePrivacyGroup : 200 OK
2021-03-26 15:18:05.302 [qtp414978148-87] INFO  c.q.t.q2t.BesuTransactionResource - Enter Request : POST : /send
2021-03-26 15:18:05.362 [pool-5-thread-1] INFO  c.q.tessera.q2t.RestPayloadPublisher - Publishing message to http://localhost:8082/
2021-03-26 15:18:05.382 [pool-5-thread-1] INFO  c.q.tessera.q2t.RestPayloadPublisher - Published to http://localhost:8082/
2021-03-26 15:18:05.384 [qtp414978148-87] INFO  c.q.t.q2t.BesuTransactionResource - Exit Request : POST : /send
2021-03-26 15:18:05.384 [qtp414978148-87] INFO  c.q.t.q2t.BesuTransactionResource - Response for send : 200 OK
2021-03-26 15:18:06.316 [qtp414978148-85] INFO  c.q.t.q2t.BesuTransactionResource - Enter Request : POST : /receive
```

Thought this was working but it isn't. Same thing is happening with Besu/Orion though.  With onchain groups turned on, 

```
creating ONCHAIN privacy group from=AwEia3o72fIT9YV+Aya0auIahYRUlev9faAvubHQFzw= with participants x6q2llVYRizI6n93OUu0Q5JlYmYDxlnPqx33Qb/Hizs= and KkOjNLmCI6r+mICrC6l+XuEDjFEzQllaMQMpWLl4y1s=

eea.sendRawTransaction with 
privateFrom AwEia3o72fIT9YV+Aya0auIahYRUlev9faAvubHQFzw=
privacyGroupId o0HHO/OEI4FacH0jRoFClXWXYerX1yqwJmhz4zX0wJk=
privateKey 8f2a55949038a9610f50fb23b5883af3b4ecb3c3bb792cbcefbd1542c692be63
(node:48104) UnhandledPromiseRejectionWarning: Error: Returned error: Onchain Privacy group does not exist.
```
and with onchain groups turned off,
```➜  multiTenancyExamplePrivateCall git:(deploy-contract-size-bug) ✗ node deployContract.js
creating ONCHAIN privacy group from=GGilEkXLaQ9yhhtbpBT03Me9iYa7U/mWXxrJhnbl1XY= with participants JhOQwapQgv36ENsICu4K21YoeU+vFLvEU/Hnt/Fcoxc= and KkOjNLmCI6r+mICrC6l+XuEDjFEzQllaMQMpWLl4y1s=
```

Have logged a bug for the example that isn't working
